communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System

Subject: Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) Request - Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs)

Dear FOIA Officer,

I am writing to request information under the provisions of the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA), specifically seeking access to records related to Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) held or discussed by the Board of Governors of the Federal Reserve System.

I kindly request the following information:

Documentation and reports pertaining to the research, development, and evaluation of Central Bank Digital Currencies (CBDCs) within the Federal Reserve System.

Correspondence, including emails, memos, and letters, between Federal Reserve officials, Board members, and external entities, such as other central banks, government agencies, and financial institutions, discussing CBDCs.

Any internal studies, white papers, or briefing materials produced by the Federal Reserve on the topic of CBDCs, including analysis of potential benefits, risks, and challenges associated with their implementation.

Records related to pilot programs or proofs-of-concept conducted by the Federal Reserve or in collaboration with other entities to explore CBDCs.

Any public statements, speeches, or presentations made by Federal Reserve officials regarding CBDCs, including transcripts or recordings of such events.

Any agreements, contracts, or arrangements between the Federal Reserve and external entities related to the development or implementation of CBDCs.

Please provide the requested information for the time period starting January 1, 2019, up until the date this FOIA request is processed.

To facilitate the review of this request, I kindly request that the information be provided in a machine-readable and searchable format, such as PDF or Word documents. If possible, please organize the records by category and date.

If any records or portions of records are being withheld or exempted from disclosure, I kindly request an indexed list specifying the withheld or redacted records along with the specific exemption(s) under the FOIA that justify their non-disclosure. Please provide the cited legal provisions or statutory exemptions for each redaction or withholding.



If my request is denied in whole or in part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions under the FOIA. Additionally, please provide me with an opportunity to appeal the decision.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to submit a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request seeking specific digital and physical documents related to government surveillance programs operated by the Westchester County Department of Public Safety. This request covers the period from 2020 to 2022. The requested documents include, but are not limited to:

Digital Documents:
a. Policies, procedures, guidelines, and training materials regarding the use of specific facial recognition software or hardware (e.g., Clearview AI, NEC NeoFace) within the Real Time Crime Center and other relevant units of the Westchester County Department of Public Safety.

c. Protocols, authorizations, and any legal opinions governing the use of cell phone tracking devices, specifically Stingray or any other similar tools utilized by the department's surveillance units.

e. Any emails, memos, or other digital communications discussing or mentioning government surveillance activities.
Physical Documents:
a. Manuals, handbooks, or printed guidelines outlining the permissible use of surveillance technologies by personnel within the Real Time Crime Center and other relevant units.
b. Copies of agreements, contracts, or memoranda of understanding with external entities regarding data sharing or access to surveillance technology.
c. Hard copies of reports, assessments, or audits conducted by the Westchester County Department of Public Safety or external entities regarding government surveillance programs.
d. Pamphlets, brochures, or printed materials used to inform the public about surveillance initiatives.
To ensure a comprehensive search, please include all relevant departments, units, and storage locations within the Westchester County Department of Public Safety, particularly focusing on the Real Time Crime Center and any other departments involved in government surveillance activities.

In compliance with applicable legal standards, I kindly request that you process this FOIA request in a manner consistent with the public's right to access information regarding government surveillance programs. Please note that the claim that disclosure would interfere with government operations must be supported by specific and demonstrable evidence.

Additionally, I request that you provide an index of any documents that are redacted or withheld in whole or in part. The index should include the title or description of each document, the specific exemption(s) applied, and the justification for each redaction or withholding.

Jordan Lassiter

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Government Surveillance Documentation - New York City Police Department (2020-2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Dear  Public Information Officer,

I am writing to submit a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request, received on [date of receipt of the request], seeking specific digital and physical documents related to government surveillance programs operated by the New York Police Department (NYPD) from the years 2020 to 2022. The requested documents include, but are not limited to:

Digital Documents:
a. Policies, procedures, guidelines, and training materials regarding the use of specific facial recognition software or hardware (e.g., Clearview AI, NEC NeoFace).
b. Records, contracts, and procurement documents related to the acquisition and use of license plate readers, including specific models or manufacturers employed by the NYPD.
c. Protocols, authorizations, and any legal opinions governing the use of cell phone tracking devices, specifically Stingray or any other similar tools utilized by the NYPD.
d. Internal reports, assessments, or audits evaluating the effectiveness, efficiency, or impact of government surveillance programs.
e. Any emails, memos, or other digital communications discussing or mentioning government surveillance activities.
Physical Documents:
a. Manuals, handbooks, or printed guidelines outlining the permissible use of surveillance technologies by NYPD personnel.
b. Copies of agreements, contracts, or memoranda of understanding with external entities regarding data sharing or access to surveillance technology.
c. Hard copies of reports, assessments, or audits conducted by the NYPD or external entities regarding government surveillance programs.
d. Pamphlets, brochures, or printed materials used to inform the public about surveillance initiatives.
To ensure a comprehensive search, please include all relevant departments, units, and storage locations within the NYPD, including the Intelligence Bureau, Technical Assistance Response Unit, and Legal Bureau.

In compliance with applicable legal standards, I kindly request that you process this FOIA request in a manner consistent with the public's right to access information regarding government surveillance programs. Please note that the claim that disclosure would interfere with government operations must be supported by specific and demonstrable evidence.

Additionally, I request that you provide an index of any documents that are redacted or withheld in whole or in part. The index should include the title or description of each document, the specific exemption(s) applied, and the justification for each redaction or withholding.

In support of this FOIA request, I refer to the following court cases:

United States v. Jones, 565 U.S. 400 (2012): This landmark Supreme Court case addressed the Fourth Amendment implications of prolonged GPS tracking and emphasized the need for warrants and limitations on government surveillance activities.
ACLU v. NYPD, 959 F.3d 546 (2d Cir. 2020): In this federal appellate court case, the court recognized the public's right to access information concerning government surveillance programs and found that vague claims of interference with government operations were insufficient to withhold requested documents.
Carpenter v. United States, 138 S. Ct. 2206 (2018): The Supreme Court held that obtaining historical cell phone location records without a warrant violates the Fourth Amendment's protection against unreasonable searches, highlighting the need for safeguards and accountability in government surveillance practices.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

title: Bellevue School District #405: Public Records Request for all electronic communications of BSD leadership (07/2022 to 05/2023)

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Bellevue School District #405: Public Records Request for all electronic communications of BSD leadership (07/2022 to 05/2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I request all electronic communications, including but not limited to emails, text messages, and instant messages, sent or received by the following individuals for the period of time between July 1, 2022 and May 16, 2023:

Superintendent Dr. Art Jarvis
Incoming Superintendent Dr. Kelly Aramaki
Deputy Superintendent, Melissa deVita
Deputy Superintendent, Eva Collins
General Counsel, Shannon McMinimee

Please provide me with copies of all such communications in electronic format, preferably in a searchable PDF or text file. 

EXEMPTION LOGS
Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION
The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

I am requesting these records in order to conduct research on a matter of public interest. I believe that these records will be helpful in understanding the activities of these individuals and their impact on the public.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

PAC Bellevue

communications.subject: Louisiana Public Records Law Request: Correctional Infraction Data (2019 - 2022)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Information on all disciplinary infractions given to incarcerated individuals from January 1, 2019 to July 31, 2022 at state correctional facilities operated by the Louisiana Department of Public Safety & Corrections. Specifically, I am seeking a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) — not paper records or a PDF created from data — with the following information for each individual disciplinary infraction: 

•	Inmate name
•	Inmate ID number assigned by the department
•	Date
•	Full legal name of the officer issuing the infraction
•	Full legal name of supervising officer
•	Full legal name of the disciplinary hearing officer (if applicable) 
•	The facility the incident occurred in
•	Security level inmate is held in
•	Time of the incident
•	Place of the incident within the prison
•	Officer’s written description of the incident
•	Inmate’s response to the infraction
•	Was force used and what type of force?
•	Specific infractions accused of
•	Severity level of the infraction
•	Outcome of the infraction (guilty, not guilty, withdrawn, etc.) 
•	Penalty from the infraction (days of lost good time, days of solitary confinement, lost privileges, etc.)
•	Was the penalty from the infraction changed or reduced at a later time?
•	Was the infraction appealed?
•	Names of witnesses involved

I recognize that each type of incident has different reporting requirements, so these are the general fields I need. 

I also recognize that this is a large request. The request is intentionally broad because I do not know what data the department maintains or for what timeframe. If necessary, I can refine my request due to data availability, time or cost considerations. 

Thank you for your assistance with this request. Please do not hesitate to contact for questions or clarifications.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Goehring

title: Training Records and Courses Offered for the Computer Crime Unit (2022-2023)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Training Records and Courses Offered for the Computer Crime Unit (2022-2023)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to submit a Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request to obtain specific records related to the training programs and courses offered to members of the Computer Crime Unit within the New York State Police for the period of January 1, 2022, to May 15, 2023. I am particularly interested in acquiring comprehensive information regarding the training curriculum, certifications, and any supporting documentation that highlights the necessity and significance of such training.

I kindly request the following specific information and documents:

Training Curriculum: Please provide the training curriculum or syllabi for all training courses offered to members of the Computer Crime Unit within the specified period. This includes details such as the course title, description, duration, and topics covered. Additionally, I request any supplementary materials, manuals, or presentations associated with each training program.
Certification Programs: Please provide information regarding any certification programs or courses completed by members of the Computer Crime Unit during the specified period. This includes the names of the certification programs, the certifying bodies, and the individuals who obtained the certifications.
Training Attendance Records: Please provide records of attendance for each training course or program offered to members of the Computer Crime Unit within the specified period. This includes the names of the participants, dates of training, and their corresponding ranks or positions within the unit.
Training Providers and Instructors: Please provide information about the organizations or institutions that provided the training courses to the Computer Crime Unit during the specified period. Include any contracts, agreements, or arrangements made with these organizations. Furthermore, kindly provide the names and qualifications of the instructors who conducted the training.
To assist in locating the requested records, please consider conducting a search in the following areas: training records and databases, course catalogs, attendance records, contracts or agreements with training providers, and any other relevant repositories of records within the New York State Police.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jordan Lassiter

Re: FOIL Number NYSP-23-05-1335
Dear Mr. Lassiter:
This will acknowledge receipt of your request for records under the Freedom of Information Law received by New York State Police on May 16, 2023. The request was for "Training Records and Courses Offered for the Computer Crime Unit (2022-2023)".
Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request, and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law.
A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached on or before November 7, 2023, or we will notify you in writing if the responsible program area(s) should require additional time to locate, assemble and review documents that may be responsive to your request.
Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs.  When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made.
PLEASE NOTE: **
As we have acknowledged your request, please refrain from submitting duplicate requests for the same records through Open FOIL. Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A list, roster, database, or comparable record documenting all of the incoming IPA mobility program assignments approved by your agency since Jan. 1, 1995. If a list, roster, database, or similar record containing responsive information is not available, I ask that you provide assignment agreement documents for each assignment. Please note: I understand and accept that some information—namely, SSN, address, DOB—would have to be redacted from the assignment agreements. It is for this reason that I've requested the records in formats that are easy to filter or redact. If records going back this far are not available, I ask that you provide records for as many years as possible.

I request expedited processing of this request under 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E)(v)(II). I am an academic researcher and I intend to use the requested records to "[engage] in disseminating information ... to inform the public concerning actual or alleged Federal Government activity."

I also ask that all fees be waived as I intend to use the requested records to publish a paper in the public interest and not for any commercial purpose. In the event you choose to impose fees, I request a detailed breakdown of the fees, including the hourly wage of each employee involved and an explanation justifying the employee hours required to fulfill the request.

Should you choose to reject this request or redact portions of it, I ask that you provide a detailed explanation and citations to the statutory exemptions and associated case law underlying your decision to withhold each/any portions from public review.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

M

title: FOIL Request: 2018-19 OSAS Aggregated Immunization Data at School District Level

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request: 2018-19 OSAS Aggregated Immunization Data at School District Level
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

New York State Department of Health
Bureau of Immunization

Greetings and salutations! Pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (Public Officers Law, Article 6, Sections 84-90), it is my esteemed honor to request access to and copies of any and all documents providing aggregated reports at a school district level concerning the information requested in the Online School Assessment Survey (OSAS) for the 2018-19 academic year, as referenced in the correspondence sent by Dr. Elizabeth Rausch-Phung in September 2018.

The materials I kindly request should include, but not be limited to:

1. Aggregated immunization data for all students in grades pre-kindergarten through 12 at the school district level.
2. Compliance rates for each school district.
3. Any available documentation or correspondence related to schools that failed to complete and submit the survey by the December 15, 2018 deadline.

In the event that any portion of this request is denied, I respectfully request an explanation for the denial, including the specific exemption(s) under the Freedom of Information Law that you believe warrant refusal. If certain records are exempt from disclosure, kindly provide access to any reasonably segregable portion of the record.

Should you determine that some portions of the requested records are exempt from disclosure, I would be most grateful if you could provide me with the remainder of the records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: ORR Death Records - May 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Background on the Records Requested
On May 12, 2023, an HHS spokesperson confirmed the death of a 17 year-old Honduran child at an ORR facility in Florida. See https://twitter.com/aurabogado/status/1657018774791520258?s=61&t=8Zqgr1Sh-7zb12EH9VIRJQ. Hours later, the public learned of another children’s death in March 2023. See https://www.cbsnews.com/news/unaccompanied-migrant-child-died-angel-eduardo-maradiaga-espinoza-us-custody-florida/. HHS referred the public to its standards in a statement aimed at explaining the services children receive. 

“The ORR Unaccompanied Children Program Policy Guide is a summary of ORR policies for the placement, release and care of unaccompanied children in ORR custody. The guide is for members of the public and other stakeholders[.]” See https://www.acf.hhs.gov/orr/policy-guidance/unaccompanied-children-program-policy-guide-introduction. Section 3.3.16 of the ORR Program Policy Guide sets forth a set of mandatory actions when a child in ORR custody. See https://www.acf.hhs.gov/orr/policy-guidance/unaccompanied-children-program-policy-guide-section-3. 

This policy requires the up to 12 separate notifications in the event of a child’s death: 

A. Reporting to Local Authorities and ORR - The care provider must immediately report the death to:
(1) Local law enforcement, as appropriate;
(2) The care provider’s State or local licensing authority;
(3) Child Protective Services, as applicable; and
(4) ORR via a Significant Incident Report.

B. Notification and Reporting within the US Department of Health and Human Services (HHS)
(5) ORR must immediately notify the appropriate staff in ORR, ACF and HHS.

C. Notifications to External Parties 
ORR must notify the following parties within 24 hours of a child’s death: 
(6) The unaccompanied alien child’s parent, legal guardian, or next-of-kin;
(7) The unaccompanied alien child’s attorney of record or the care provider’s local legal service provider;
(8) The applicable consulate;
(9) The child advocate, if applicable;
(10) Congressional officials
(11) The local U.S. Immigrations and Customs Enforcement (ICE), Field Office Juvenile Coordinator (FOJC); and
(12) The Department of Homeland Security, ICE, Enforcement and Removal Operations, Juvenile and Family Residential Management Unit (ERO/JFRMU).

Description of Records Requested
Requested Records Set #1. 
Please provide any of the 12 notifications itemized above based on ORR policy that occurred in each of the two publicly reported deaths of children in ORR custody during 2023. 
Requested Records Set #2. 
Please provide any other notifications of deaths in ORR custody that were made after the current ORR Policy 3.3.16 went into effect on July 22, 2019. 

Thank you, 

#DetentionKills Transparency Initiative 
Al Otro Lado

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Andrew Free

Sincerely,

communications.subject: Alabama Open Records Law Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alabama Open Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

The applications for licensure for the entities A.M. Sky LLC, 1819 Labs LLC, and Justice Cannabis Alabama LLC have been almost entirely redacted. I would like to see the names of the individual members and their states of residence for these applications. Thank you in advance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

André Natta, a citizen of Alabama, in coordination with Tony Fritz.
